title: Test
yAxis: GDP per capita in U.S. dollars
summary: The chart at hand is a line chart where the x axis denotes Year and a y axis denotes GDP per capita in U.S. dollars. In total the number of data points it has is 11.
Overall GDP per capita in U.S. dollars has decreased over the Year.
The line drastically decreased by 4.4 times from Year 2015 to 2016.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2015 and 2016.
Maximum GDP per capita in U.S. dollars, about 1309.95 was reported at Year 2014
The lowest GDP per capita in U.S. dollars, of value 243.27 was reported at Year 2020
min_summary: This is a line chart with an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP per capita in U.S. dollars, containing a total of 11 data points.
In general GDP per capita in U.S. dollars has fallen over the Year.

GDP per capita in U.S. dollars is roughly constant from 2014 to 2015, rapidly decreasing from 2015 to 2016, roughly constant from 2016 to 2017, slightly increasing from 2017 to 2018, slightly decreasing from 2018 to 2019, and finally roughly constant from 2019 to 2024.
